result.execSummary:
The defendant Nickolas G. Formiller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $8941.49 paid directly to the Clerk of Court's Office prior to sentencing.  The 10% surcharge in the amount of $894.15 still due and owing - same repayment conditions apply as noted below for the Costs.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restituion to Helena Chemical Co - Ck No 010764

Case Called @ 10:50 AM: Defendant Nickolas G. Formiller in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per ADA:  Full restitution of $8941.49 has been PIF just prior to going of record.  State will move for amendment to Misd Level IOWC and State will recommend Court Costs as penalty.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court accepts State's motion to amend to Misd Level IOWC - Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  No Statement offered by Def.  The Court:  Recognizing that the complainant has been made whole, Orders $8941.49 restitution, noting that has been fulfilled and Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP.  By law DNA Surcharge and 10% Surcharge that is attached.  Appeal Rights Given.   DNA Sample not ordered to be provided, only surcharge.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney John B. Selsing in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Selsing requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 10:45 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney John B. Selsing in court, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Selsing is still sorting thru facts of case.  STC adjourned - Notice Given.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on March 13, 2015 at 01:50 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:49 p.m. Defendant Nickolas G. Formiller in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has retained Attorney Selsing who could not be present today but advised the defendant as to how he should proceed today.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. The court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 01:50 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant is prohibited from issuing any checks for payment.

Case Called @ 1:15 PM: Defendant Nickolas G. Formiller in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wishes to retain counsel.  Court will proceed with that understanding that Counsel will be obtained.  ADA argues for Signature Bond w/conditions.  No statement as to bond by Def.  The Court:  Orders Signature Bond as requested.  Def questions Court as to open checking accounts currently in place.  AIA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
